content: Who were the original members of the band Def Leppard, and how many of them are still with the band?

chosen:
The original members of Def Leppard were Joe Elliott (lead vocals), Steve Clark (guitar), Pete Willis (guitar), Rick Savage (bass) and Tony Kenning (drums).

Joe Elliott and Rick Savage are the only two original members that remain in the current line-up.
rejected:
Def Leppard was formed in 1977 by guitarist Steve Clark and drummer Rick Allen. The other original members were bassist Mark Campbell, singer Joe Elliott, and keyboard player Ian Hunter.

Allen left the band in 1984 due to health issues, and was replaced by drummer Rick Savage. In 1992, Campbell also left the band, and was replaced by bassist Rick "Spike" Edwards.

As of 2023, the current lineup of Def Leppard consists of Elliot, Clark, Savage, Edwards, and new guitarist Phil Collen.
